text: Orsha () is an urban locality (an urban-type settlement) in Kalininsky District of Tver Oblast, Russia, located northeast of the city of Tver, on the right bank of the Orsha River, and surrounded by swamps. Population: ==History== Orsha was founded in 1955, when peat extraction started. Until 1994, the Orshinskoye-1 Peat Extraction Plant was the main employer in the settlement, but then it decayed and eventually was closed. It is currently defunct. In 1974, Orsha was granted urban-type settlement status. ==Economy== ===Industry=== The industry of Orsha is based on peat and timber production. ===Transportation=== Orsha is connected by a road with Tver. ==References== ===Notes=== ===Sources=== * * * Category:Urban-type settlements in Tver Oblast
title: Orsha (urban-type settlement), Tver Oblast
